Software for deep learning

21 Feb 2017

The Montreal Institute for Learning Algorithms (MILA) maintains a long list of deep learning software. I’ve only ever used Theano and Pylearn2 and need to familiarize myself with the current state of deep learning tools as I re-boot an existing project. This post is my attempt to organize basic information about a limited set of tools to help me decide exactly what to use for my current project.

Computation Engines (Back ends)

Name | Language | Description –|—|– Theano | Python | Define, optimize, and evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays efficiently to run on CPU or GPU Tensor Flow | Python | Numerical computation using data flow graphs, similar to Theano Torch | Lua | Scientific computing framework, Tensor computation with strong GPU acceleration Caffe | Python | Machine vision library that ported Matlab fast CNNs to C and C++, not intended for other data types ND4J | Java | Scientific computing libraries for the JVM

Interface Libraries

Name | Language | Description | Back ends
–|—|– Pylearn2 | Python | Provides reusable common components, no longer actively developped | Theano GroundHog | Python | Complex recurrent neural network models, development discontinued, moved to Blocks | Theano Lasagne | Python | Lightweight library to build and train neural networks in Theano. | Theano Keras | Python | High-level library for fast experimentation | Theano, TensorFlow Blocks | Python | Quick prototyping of complex neural network models, annotates the Theano computational graph instead of adding abstractions, consists of Bricks (reusable common components), large graph management, training algorithms and training abilities. | Theano Fuel | Python | Download/iterate/preprocess datasets to pipe into Blocks | Theano PyTorch | Python | Not a Python binding into a C++ framework, can use it naturally like you would use numpy / scipy / scikit-learn | Torch Deeplearning4j | Java | Distributed deep-learning in Java and Scala | ND4J

References

  • http://deeplearning.net/software_links/
  • https://deeplearning4j.org/compare-dl4j-torch7-pylearn

Maryanne Amacher, composer and installation artist (1938–2009)

Newer

Debian installation and configuration

OS Install

I decided to go with Debian for the operating system because I wanted to be able to use the NeuroDebian repository. I may experiment with other Debian derivatives in the future. I wrote the Live disk image for Debian 8 “Jessie” (with firmware + nonfree) to a bootable USB drive for the installation.
